events.originalText: A British Special Air Service unit ambushed a Provisional Irish Republican Army (IRA) unit in Loughgall, Northern Ireland, killing eight IRA members and one civilian.
events.subtitle: Special Air Service
events.headline: British SAS unit kills 8 IRA members in Loughgall ambush

events.originalText: Four members of Black September hijacked Sabena Flight 571 to demand the release of 315 Palestinians convicted on terrorism charges.
events.subtitle: Black September Organization
events.headline: Black September hijacks Sabena Flight 571 for Palestinian release

events.originalText: Construction workers attacked students and others who were protesting the Vietnam War in New York City.
events.subtitle: Hard Hat Riot
events.headline: Construction workers attack Vietnam War protesters in NYC

events.originalText: In Huế, South Vietnam, soldiers opened fire into a crowd of Buddhists protesting against a government ban on the flying of the Buddhist flag on Phật Đản, killing nine and sparking the Buddhist crisis.
events.subtitle: Huế
events.headline: Soldiers fire into crowd of Buddhists in Huế, killing 9

events.originalText: South Vietnamese president Ngô Đình Diệm began a state visit to the United States, his regime's main sponsor.
events.subtitle: South Vietnam
events.headline: South Vietnamese president Ngô Đình Diệm visits US

events.originalText: The Tollund Man (pictured), a naturally mummified corpse, was discovered in a peat bog near Silkeborg, Denmark.
events.subtitle: Tollund Man
events.headline: Tollund Man discovered in peat bog in Denmark

events.originalText: A parade in Sétif, French Algeria, celebrating the end of World War II in Europe became a riot and was followed by reprisals, carried out by colonial authorities over the following weeks, that killed thousands.
events.subtitle: Sétif
events.headline: Sétif parade riot leads to thousands killed in French Algeria

events.originalText: World War II: The Axis launched a major counteroffensive, turning the tide of the Battle of the Kerch Peninsula.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Axis launches counteroffensive in Battle of Kerch Peninsula

events.originalText: French aviators Charles Nungesser and François Coli aboard the biplane L'Oiseau Blanc took off from Paris, attempting to make the first non-stop flight to New York, only to disappear before arrival.
events.subtitle: Charles Nungesser
events.headline: Aviators attempt non-stop flight to New York, disappear

events.originalText: Lithuania signed the Klaipėda Convention, making the Klaipėda Region (taken from East Prussia) into an autonomous region under Lithuanian rule.
events.subtitle: Klaipėda Convention
events.headline: Lithuania signs Klaipėda Convention for autonomous region

events.originalText: A train derailed and caught fire near Versailles, France, killing at least 52 people.
events.subtitle: Versailles rail accident
events.headline: Train derails near Versailles, killing at least 52

events.originalText: Greek War of Independence: At the Battle of Gravia Inn, a 120-man Greek force led by Odysseas Androutsos repulsed an Ottoman army of 8,000 soldiers.
events.subtitle: Greek War of Independence
events.headline: Greek forces repel Ottoman army at Battle of Gravia Inn

events.originalText: First English Civil War: The first siege of Wardour Castle ended after six days with the surrender of the Royalist garrison under Lady Blanche Arundell (pictured).
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: Royalist garrison surrenders at first siege of Wardour Castle
